item.title: HACKING.md
item.description: https://github.com/golang/go/blob/master/src/runtime/HACKING.md å¾…ç¿»è¯‘ This is a living document and at times it will be out of date. It is intended to articulate how programming in the Go runtime differs from writing normal Go. It focuses on pervasive concepts rather than details of particular interfaces. Scheduler structures The scheduler manages three types of resources that pervade the runtime: Gs, Ms, and Ps. It’s important to understand these even if you’re

item.title: The "figure" Shortcode
item.description: Hugo has figure shortcode built in, so you can easily add figcaptions or hyperlink rel attributes to images. Documentations can be found here: https://gohugo.io/content-management/shortcodes/#figure This theme has 3 CSS classes made for figure elements: big: images will break the width limit of main content area. left: images will float to the left. right: images will float to the right. If a figure has no class set, the image will behave just like a normal markdown image: !

item.title: Post With Featured Image
item.description: Just define the image URL in the contentâ€™s front matter, the featured image will be displayed as the background. For example: ---images:- https://picsum.photos/1024/768/?random---This is an array, you can set multiple urls, only the first url will be used. These images is also used in Twitter Cards and the Open Graph metadata.
